item.title: Starfield: How Long Is Shattered Space DLC?
item.description:
Bethesda is known for releasing some meaty DLCs for its games, offering tons of more hours for players to sink their teeth into. Now, Starfield has joined that list with the new Shattered Space DLC release. This expansion takes players to the homeworld of House Va'ruun, a religious sect that has been around since the game's launch in 2023. It looks to expand upon the mechanics laid out in Starfield and bring a brand-new storyline to see another side of the galaxies.

Of course, players might be wondering how long it will take to beat Shattered Space . With Bethesda having quite a few lengthy DLCs under their belt, players are likely anticipating a good chunk of content to come to the already massive game.

How Long Is Shattered Space?

As of now, Shattered Space brings a lot of new content to explore in the game. Overall, the new story has seven missions for players to complete, with each one requiring multiple steps to complete.

How Long Is Shattered Space's Main Story?

If a player was to just put their head down and rush through the main stories of the expansion, they can anticipate spending roughly 10 hours on the expansion . It all depends on how long they spend on each mission and in which order they complete them.

How Long Is A Complete Playthrough Of Shattered Space?

However, no one really plays Bethesda games like that, and that surely won't be the case with most players jumping into this expansion. If someone is going to explore every nook and cranny of the new planet, spend time doing the side missions as well, and everything else that is offered in Shattered Space , they can expect to spend upwards of 25 to 30 hours on the new content.

It's hard to give a definitive number on how long players will spend on the expansion since everyone plays differently. However, these are accurate estimations based on Bethesda's previous DLC lengths and other games .

That's a solid amount of time given that Shattered Space is Bethesda's biggest expansion to date, at least in terms of file size. The update comes in at a solid 12GB of data , so it makes sense that there would be a lot to do.

item.title: Throne And Liberty: How To Farm Lucent
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Ways To Farm Lucent In Throne And Liberty
  • Activites That Reward Lucent In Throne And Liberty

When games are live-service, they are bound to have all kinds of currencies that players can use to purchase various items, and Throne and Liberty is no different. There are a few different currencies that players can use to make certain purchases, both in the game and also in the form of microtransactions like the battle pass. In order for people to purchase the latter, they will need to have enough Lucent, the game's premium currency . This currency is used to make purchases at the in-game shop as well as the in-game Auction House, where players can sell their own materials to each other for various rewards.

As such, Lucent is not the easiest currency to earn in the game. The Auction House and store are the places where players can get some of the very best equipment and items, so the developers have made Lucent a little tougher to get than the standard currency players can earn through the game. However, there is a method to get Lucent faster and ensure that a player can get what they want from the Auction House and store. This guide details just what that method is.

Best Ways To Farm Lucent In Throne And Liberty

The best way to farm Lucent is to actually use the Auction House and sell some rare goods. While players can spend Lucent there, they can also earn it — if they sell the right stuff. There are a few different items that can provide the best amount of payment.

Sell Traits For Lucent

Traits are progression items that players can use to improve their characters , but they can also be removed using the Trait Extraction Stone to take it out of the item to sell. They can be earned through completing events and quests in the game, and selling a Trait could net you 100 Lucent in one trade.

The highest-priced Traits to sell are:

  • Heavy Attack
  • Skill Damage Boost
  • Skill Damage Resistance
  • Evasion
  • Hit
  • Crit
  • Attack Speed
  • Range
  • Max Health
  • Buff Duration

Sell Rune Hammer Bundles For Lucent

Rune Hammer bundles can best be obtained through completing Tier 5 Challenge Mode Dungeons to get Runes. Turn those Runes into Rune Fragments, and then craft the bundles.

There are some other events where players can find Runes as well:

  • Completing Open-World Dungeons
  • Dynamic Events
  • Guild Raids
  • Field Bosses

Sell Rare Food Items For Lucent

Players can also sell any rare food item they come across through cooking. To get the most amount of Lucent, players will need to cook the higher tier recipes, which will require a higher level and the best ingredients. But, even some of the lower tiered ones can offer a good chunk of Lucent.

Here are some great Food Items to sell whenever possible:

  • Kaster Banquet
  • Vienta Banquet
  • Golden Rye Banquet
  • Daybreak Shore Banque

The only thing is that the Auction House can only be accessed once a player has reached Level 40 , so players will have to level up quite a bit to get there.

Activites That Reward Lucent In Throne And Liberty

While the Auction House may be the best bet for players to farm Lucent, it can be obtained through other means in the game as well. Players can earn Lucent by taking part in these different activities:

  • Castle Siege
  • Cross-Server Wars
  • Tax Delivery Events
  • Rift Stone Bosses
  • Routine tasks

Of course, players can also use their real money to purchase it from the game as well, but most people will probably want to avoid that as much as possible.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How to Make All Cupcakes
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Make All Cupcakes in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Gameloft’s 2022 life sim Disney Dreamlight Valley has more than 300 meals that players can make as they make their way through the game. You can share these meals with your friends, or make them to complete your quests, Star Path tasks, and Dreamlight Duties.

The base game had just one basic Cupcake recipe, but the recent Dreamlight Parks Fest event has introduced many new cupcakes in DDV . In this guide, we will share recipes for all cupcakes that you can make in Dreamlight Valley .

How to Make All Cupcakes in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Here are all the Cupcakes recipes in DDV:

Cupcakes

  • 1 x Wheat
  • 1 x Egg
  • 1 x Cherry
  • 1 x Agave

Wheat is a handy ingredient that you can grow by buying Wheat Seeds, planting them, watering them once, and harvesting them after a minute. You can buy these seeds from Goofy’s Stall in the Peaceful Meadow and Ancient’s Landing biomes for only one Star Coin.

Eggs are available at Chez Remy’s Pantry for 220 Star Coins. Cherries can be picked from Cherry Trees at Sunlit Plateau and Frosted Heights biome. Agave is a sweet ingredient that fans can find growing on green spiky plants in Glittering Dunes.

Mermaid Cupcakes

  • 1 x Milk
  • 1 x Wheat
  • 1 x Butter
  • 1 x Sugarcane
  • 1 x Scallop

Milk can be bought at Chez Remy’s Pantry for 230 Star Coins. Get Wheat by planting and harvesting Wheat Seeds. The next ingredient is Butter, which costs 190 Star Coins at Remy’s Pantry. For Sugarcane, purchase Sugarcane Seeds for five Star Coins at Goofy’s Stall at Dazzle Beach, plant them, and harvest after seven minutes. You can find Scallops on the ground at Dazzle Beach.

Minnie Cupcakes

  • 1 x Milk
  • 1 x Wheat
  • 1 x Butter
  • 1 x Sugarcane
  • 1 x Apple

For Milk and Butter, head to Chez Remy’s Pantry. To get Wheat and Sugarcane, grow them from their seeds. Apples can be picked from Apple Trees in the Plaza or Forgotten Lands.

Princess Aurora Raspberry Cupcakes

  • 1 x Milk
  • 1 x Wheat
  • 1 x Butter
  • 1 x Sugarcane
  • 1 x Raspberry

Visit Chez Remy’s Pantry for Milk and Butter. Buy Wheat Seeds and Sugarcane Seeds from Goofy’s Stall and then plant and harvest them. Raspberry can be collected from Raspberry Bushes located in the Plaza and Peaceful Meadow.

Spaceship Earth Cupcakes

  • 1 x Milk
  • 1 x Wheat
  • 1 x Butter
  • 1 x Sugarcane
  • 1 x Coconut

Players can buy milk and butter from the kitchen area at Chez Remy. As mentioned above, you can grow Wheat and Sugarcane from their seeds. Gather Coconut from the Coconut Trees at Dazzle Beach.

Stitch Cupcakes

  • 1 x Milk
  • 1 x Wheat
  • 1 x Butter
  • 1 x Sugarcane
  • 1 x Blueberry

Milk and Butter are available at Chez Remy’s Pantry, and Wheat and Sugarcane are grown from their seeds. Blueberries can be picked from Blueberry Bushes at Dazzle Beach or Forest of Valor. Once you have everything in your backpack, go to a nearby cooking station and combine them in a pot to make your cupcakes.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: 10 Secrets That Will Make You Start Another Playthrough
item.description:
There are so many ways to experience Baldur's Gate 3 that could warrant an entirely new playthrough, including entirely new interactions and even secret endings. Even a year after the game's release, there's a lot to find and new ways to play the game that might spark the urge to start a new character.

With the release of Patch 7, many players have started a new Baldur's Gate 3 playthrough to see how the new evil endings look, but there are some other secrets players may have missed along the way. Given how large the game is and how many choices can be made, it's no surprise that there are still weapons some may not have found, or new characters that only pop up with some specific steps to meet them.

Warning: This article contains major spoilers for all Acts of Baldur's Gate 3!

10 Craft the Vision of the Absolute

Find the Broken Pieces of a Secret Spear

In Act 1, Tav can come across two siblings trying to save their brother, Edowin, who has just been attacked by an Owlbear. It doesn't really matter what choice is made here because he'll die either way, and players just need to loot his body to find the Broken Shaft of a Spear.

Make sure to hold onto it, and head towards the Owlbear Cave just ahead on the same path. Once inside, whether by killing the Owlbear mother or sneaking past her, make sure to get the Head of a Broken Spear off of her. Once both are acquired, combine them to receive the Vision of the Absolute Spear, which has the special Absolute Night ability that blinds targets that save a failed Dexterity throw and deals additional Piercing damage to creatures with multiple eyes.

9 Unlock the Titanstring Bow

Deliver the Missing Shipment to the Zhentarim Hideout

In Act 1, players can come across a cave where two traders are hiding from a group of Gnolls who are attacking them. This is part of the Missing Shipment quest, which can be completed in a variety of ways, but for this variant, the shipment must be delivered (unopened) to the Zhentarim Hideout. This is something a lot of players may have missed because many have chosen to take the contents of the shipment for themselves - which includes the Iron Flask inside.

Once delivered, the Titanstring Bow can be purchased from Bhrem in the Zhentarim Hideout. The weapon lets players deal additional damage equal to their own Strength modifier, making it an excellent choice for tank classes. More damage to this bow is added by taking potions like Elixir of Hill Giant Strength, making it a one-shot potential weapon for earlier areas of Baldur's Gate 3 .

8 Explore the Arcane Tower's Basement

Take Bernard's Ring to Find the Staff of Arcane Blessing

The Arcane Tower is one of the more interesting areas to be discovered while exploring the Underdark, but meeting Bernard doesn't spell the end of this adventure. Equipping the Guiding Light Ring will see players gifted with a reward for solving their riddle, and a hidden button appears on the elevator which takes players between floors.

This button will take Tav to the basement of the Tower, where they can find the Staff of Arcane Blessing near some bookshelves. The special thing about this Staff is Mystra's Blessing, which gives the wielder an extra 1d4 to Saving Throws and Attack Rolls, and an extra 2d4 to all Spell Attack Rolls.

7 Erase Minthara's Mind

Take Over the Interrogation of Minthara

If Minthara was spared in Act 1, players can run into her in Moonrise Towers before saving the Nightsong in Act 2. She's being interrogated by Ketheric Thorm and Disciple Z'rell, and sparing her implies she can be recruited after the Emerald Grove, but there are worse fates that await her.

However, without intervention, players can go down to the Moonrise Towers Prison and find her a second time being questioned by Sumera. Here, there are two choices; either let Questioner Sumera break her and erase her memory, or use deception or intimidation to take over the questioning. In this case, players can erase Minthara's memory entirely, convince her to pretend her mind is broken or get her to join the party.

6 Take Araj Oblodra's Offer

A Little Blood Can go a Long Way

Araj Oblodra in Moonrise Towers is hidden away in the lab on the east side of the Tower. She has a strange request and desires Tav's blood, which gives a powerful special potion depending on the character's race.

That's not all, though, because, with Astarion in the party, she will ask him to bite her neck in exchange for another potion. He'll disapprove if he is forced to do it, but he can get a Potion of Everlasting Vigour in return, which permanently increases the Strength score of whoever drinks it by 2.

5 How to Find the Killer's Sweetheart Ring

Fight Yourself and Your Mirror Allies For a Neat Ring

When inside the Gauntlet of Shar in Act 2, players can discover a room where they must battle mirror versions of themselves and their party in the Self-Same Trial. Because the bodies of these mirror images disappear immediately, players might have missed out on a powerful ring that can be discovered upon their defeat.

After giving the offering to Shar, look for the Killer's Sweetheart Ring on a bench near the brazier. When wearing the ring, the next Attack roll made after killing a creature will be an immediate Critical Hit, making it an incredibly strong Boon to have for the rest of the game. This ability can only be used once, but it does refresh after a Long Rest.

4 Meet Honk in Act 3

A New NPC to Grunt and Serve Drinks on a Date With Karlach

Honk is possibly one of the rarest characters due to the absurdly specific steps required in order to meet him. Not only do players need to romance Karlach, but they need to Firstly, players need to kill Henk, the owner of the Singing Lute Tavern in the Lower City. Only after this is it a good idea to go on a date with Karlach.

In the original scene, without any interference from the player, Henk serves Tav and Karlach on their date. But, if he is killed beforehand, he will be replaced by Honk, who is assumed to be his brother. A few months ago, Honk didn't even have a wiki page to his name - indicating how rare this interaction is.

3 The Ringless Gem and Gemless Ring

An Easy-to-Miss Secret in Rivington

This ring can be easy to miss because the Ringless Gem component can only be bought from a trader, Ferg Drogher, in Rivington if Shadowheart is not in the party. Considering she's one of the most popular party members among players, it's likely that most also may have missed this.

Drogher sells the Ringless Gem, and players can find the Gemless Ring on a corpse near the cliffs toward the east of Rivington. Put them together, and players can craft an Uncommon Tarnished Ring. Unfortunately, it doesn't have any special abilities, but it may be an Easter Egg that Baldur's Gate 3 players have yet to figure out. Either way, it's a cool little discovery in Act 3 that some may not have known about.

2 Craft The Hellfire Engine Crossbow

Discover the Weapon in the Steel Watch Foundry

While completing the Disable the Steel Watch quest in Act 3, search the office at the back of the building to find the Watcher Crossbow Blueprint. Then, players need to find a Targeting Module, Steel Watcher Arm, and a Table in order to craft the Hellfire Engine Crossbow from the blueprints. The Arm is found at X: -280 Y: -164 and the Module at X: -305 Y: -156, while the table is in the same room players found the Blueprint.

To craft the Hellfire Engine Crossbow, interact with the Table and simply put together the parts. The crossbow comes with really decent damage, but it also unlocks the Lightning Arrow spell for the wielder - which allows them to cast an arrow of electricity which bursts on impact and deals additional Lightning damage to any creatures around it.

1 Get the Boots of Very Fast Blinking

Give in to Akabi's Wheel of Wonder

The Circus of the Last Day remains one of the most interesting areas in Act 3, and Akabi the Djinn has become renowned for turning players into a wheel of cheese or sending them to a secret jungle full of dinosaurs. However, those who have some patience and continue to play his Wheel of Wonder can get the Boots of Very Fast Blinking.

The boots are considered a junk item, but they have a mechanic that allows players to use Misty Step as many times as they want without expending a spell slot. The caveat, however, is that players will teleport without their clothes. Weapons and accessories aren't affected by this, though, so it could make for some very strange and creative encounters in fights.

item.title: Throne And Liberty: Difference Between Classic And Action Mode
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is Classic Mode In Throne And Liberty?
  • What Is Action Mode In Throne And Liberty?
  • Which Camera Mode Should Players Choose?

There are a ton of different ways for players to customize their experience in Throne and Liberty , and one of the most significant methods is choosing between two different camera modes. These two modes, Classic and Action, offer different ways for players to experience the game and it's moment-to-moment action. While it may be assumed to not offer that much of a difference, the two modes actually do differ enough to almost feel like different kinds of games.

Knowing the differences between the two is critical to crafting your ideal experience in this MMO. This guide is here to help explain the differences between the Classic and Action camera modes in Throne and Liberty .

What Is Classic Mode In Throne And Liberty?

The first mode, and what the game defaults to, is Classic Mode, which brings a more familiar MMO camera feel to the game. It is similar to how a game like World of Warcraft would play, and it gives players much more precise control of the game.

In Classic Mode, the camera remains fixed (unless the player clicks and drags the mouse to turn it). In doing this, the cursor will always be active and allow players to select the different elements on the HUD much more easily. Players can click on different enemies to target them and then click on the toolbar to choose which ability or attack they want to use.

With the camera fixed, Classic Mode gives a much more watchful view of the battlefield at all times and offers up a more strategic feel to combat. Classic mode is great for players who favor tactical precision over immersion.

It suits best to have the camera pulled back from the character more in this mode to get a better view of the battlefield.

What Is Action Mode In Throne And Liberty?

Action Mode, on the other hand, is much more, well, action-oriented. It strips away constant control of the cursor to allow the mouse or right stick to control the camera at all times. As players move the stick, so will the camera move with it .

This makes the moment-to-moment gameplay feel more fluid , though it takes away the player's ability to be precise in their overall HUD interactions. This mode is more about keeping the action going, only occasionally using the HUD when necessary.

The target of attacks is going to be dependent on where the crosshair is, rather than the mouse cursor.

Players who choose this camera mode are going to use their number keys to use their abilities more often. They'll also have more control over their weapons and attacks.

This mode is best suited for having the camera zoomed in closer to the character , like a typical third-person action game, to be closer to the action.

Which Camera Mode Should Players Choose?

Largely, this comes down to personal preference and how a player wants to experience the game. However, Action Mode might have a slight edge over Classic .

The snappier controls and ability to have more control over each attack just feels good. While Classic mode may enable better strategy and tactics, Action is just more fun to play overall . It truly feels like how the game should be played.

Luckily, players can switch between the two through the game's Settings menu at any point, so they can and should play around with both options until they find what works for them.
